column5: Goodbye wheel bearings, ball joints, tie rods etc lol!  Pretty damn sweet regardless, though i would never run those on my truck

I can't imagine what this will do to your tires as they drive these units.The pressure on the the steering components must be extreme!!  I wonder if they have a two wheel drive version with skis on the front.  vance

haha if I needed to get serious about ice fishing I'd spring for one of these, it floats, is insulated has seats you can sleep in it and the floor pops out so you can pull up to your hole pop the floor and start fishing! but back in the real world... a clam haha  http://realfishing.com/2012/08/snobear/
They're nice, but not for the price the want.
I think you could buy a decent sled for the price of the tracks... I think that would be the better option.
Agreed on all counts......I actually had to look to see if he was driving in reverse in order to get the tracks/truck to go forward
We used to put lunch trays under the back wheels of the front wheel drive cars in the parking lot. You can slide all over the place till the tray wears through.    Art
